According to the commentary, this gate exists, but the Sanskrit text is originally missing. In the great treatise on the Abhidharma, the second gate on the causes for designations. A question in the treatise states:

What is the cause for the precious woman possessed by a wheel-turning sage king, whose wondrous appearance and uprightness are pleasing to behold, surpassing human appearance and having the color and form of a celestial being?
The answer:

The precious woman of a wheel-turning sage king, in her past cultivation of causes, her affairs were vast, able to give with purity various things, namely pure various adornments, as well as other food, drink, clothing, unguents, incense, powders, beds, seats, dwellings, and lamps.
For this reason, the precious woman of the wheel-turning king is of wonderful color and appearance, pleasing to the eyes of the people, with a human form and heavenly appearance.
He also asked:
Why is it that the precious woman of the wheel-turning king is neither white nor black, with a complexion of medium hue, neither tall nor short, neither fat nor thin, with a well-proportioned body?
He replied:

That precious woman, in her past cultivation of causes, her affairs were vast, able to practice giving, namely, with all colors, fragrances, and flavors complete, food and drink, etc., held in her own hands, offered with an unassuming mind, practicing giving.
For this reason, the precious woman she possesses is neither white nor black, with a complexion of medium hue, neither tall nor short, neither fat nor thin, with a well-proportioned body.
He also asked:
Why is it that the precious woman of the wheel-turning king, when cold, is warm and comfortable, pleasing to the mind?
He replied:

As for her treasures, in the past she cultivated causes extensively, meaning that if there were times of severe cold in winter when a great wind blew and the scenery was extremely cold, people would be frightened.

When the female treasure was at that time, she did not harm her parents, acquaintances, teachers, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as, brÄhmaá¹‡as, and so forth, and she loved those who did not harm others. She then used things that were warm, namely clothing, bedding, ointments, incense, beds, seats, houses, charcoal stoves, and other warm necessities, and widely practiced giving.
For this reason, the female treasure of the wheel-turning king is warm when cold and happily comfortable.
He also asked:
What is the reason why the female treasure of the wheel-turning king is cool when hot and happily comfortable?
He replied:

As for her preciousness, in the past she cultivated causes extensively, meaning that if there were times of scorching heat, the sun's light would be oppressive, and heat-born insects would follow, greatly vexing people.

When the precious woman was at that time, she did not give rise to harm towards her parents, acquaintances, teachers, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as, brÄhmaá¹‡as, and so forth, and she also loved those who did not harm, and then used things such as coolness, meaning she widely practiced giving by holding clothes, bedding, ointments, incense powder, beds, seats, houses, precious footstools, precious ornaments, bracelets, tamÄla leaves, and various implements and other necessities.
For this reason, the precious woman of the wheel-turning king is cool and blissful in hot weather.
He also asked:
What is the reason that the precious woman of the wheel-turning king has the fragrance of sandalwood in all the pores of her body, and always emits the fragrance of utpala flowers from her mouth?
He replied:

As for her preciousness, in the past she cultivated causes extensively, namely, she did not harm her parents, friends, teachers, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as, and she loved those who did not harm others. She widely practiced giving by using agarwood, olibanum, saffron, tamÄla, and other excellent fragrances.
Because of these causes, the pores of her body emit the fragrance of sandalwood, and her mouth always emits the fragrance of blue lotus flowers.
He also asked:

Why does the precious woman of the wheel-turning sage king serve the wheel-turning sage king, rising first, sitting later, not losing propriety, being able to attend to whatever she does, diligently and without arrogance, and speaking lovingly?
He replied:
For a long time, the wheel-turning sage king, according to his actions, increased his wholesome karma, nurturing and ripening it, and it manifested as superior rewards.
Because of these causes, he obtained the precious woman who speaks lovingly and obeys him.
He also asked:

What is the reason that the female treasure of a wheel-turning king can delight the mind of the wheel-turning sage king and be in accord with him, yet be without a defiled mind, let alone not being unyielding in body and speech?
Answer:
The wheel-turning sage king possesses great majestic virtue, and has never had a different mind towards any sentient being, surpassing the thoughts of others.
For this reason, the female treasure he attracts delights his mind and is in accord with him, yet is without a defiled mind.
Again, it is asked:
What is the reason that when the wheel-turning king's female treasure wants to go somewhere or sit or stand, she knows it beforehand and immediately goes before the king to say:
Excellent, sage king!
Whether you want to go somewhere or sit or stand, I will follow you everywhere.
The answer is:

As for her preciousness, in the past she cultivated causes extensively, namely, possessing a compassionate mind, observing sentient beings in the desire realm, desiring meaning, desiring benefit, and desiring peace and happiness, or if sentient beings give rise to a desire for no benefit and no peace and happiness, she gave rise to a compassionate mind and observed them with eyes of compassion.
For this reason, the precious woman of the wheel-turning king knows all the king's movements in advance.
He also asked:
Why is it that the precious woman of the wheel-turning king surpasses ordinary women in the world, like the moon among the stars?
He replied:
As for that precious woman, in the past she cultivated causes extensively, namely, not killing herself and also teaching others to uphold the precept against killing.
Not stealing, not engaging in sexual misconduct, not lying, and not drinking alcohol, and also teaching others to practice each one.
For this reason, the precious woman of the wheel-turning king surpasses all women, like the moon among the stars.
He also asked:
Why is it that the female treasure of a wheel-turning king does not give birth?
Answer:
The common suffering of all women is the suffering of the womb and childbirth.

That female treasure, for a long time, has little illness and little affliction, performs various wholesome actions, and cultivates and perfects them. The superior and wonderful fruits and rewards are accomplished in the present.
For this reason, the female treasure of a wheel-turning king does not give birth.
Again, it is asked:
Why is it that the female treasure of a wheel-turning king first passes away before the wheel-turning king?
The answer:
That female treasure cultivates various wholesome actions for a long time without interruption. The superior and wonderful fruits and rewards are accomplished in the present.
For this reason, the female treasure of a wheel-turning king first passes away before the wheel-turning sage king.
Again, it is asked:
Why is it that the female treasure of a wheel-turning king alone is born in the heavens among all women?
The answer:
That female treasure, by nature, is virtuous and good, and further extensively cultivates the ten wholesome courses of action.
For this reason, the precious woman of the wheel king alone is born in the heavens among all women.
Again, it is asked:
What is the reason that the wheel-turning sage king obtains the precious minister in charge of the treasury?
The answer is:

The wheel-turning sage king, in his past cultivation of causes, his affairs were vast, namely, if there were times of extreme cold or heat, the king, in those times of cold and heat, did not give rise to harm towards his parents, acquaintances, teachers, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as, and he loved those who did not give rise to harm. He used excellent medicine according to the time, as well as the most delicious food and drink that he loved, and other necessities, to serve and provide for them.
After they received them, their bodies were not unclean, and their clothes were not uncovered. Day and night they always experienced happiness.
For this reason, the wheel-turning sage king is able to obtain the precious minister in charge of the treasury.

As for the chief minister of the treasury, he is greatly wealthy and self-sufficient, with a vast retinue, abundant treasures in his storehouses, and overflowing wealth and grain, increasing and accumulating his enjoyments.
As a result of good karma, he is born with the heavenly eye, able to see hidden treasures, whether they have an owner or not, whether they are in water or on land, whether they are near or far.
He comes to the place of the wheel-turning king, and even provides him with various things in abundance, diligently and tirelessly, respectfully addressing the king, saying:
Whatever wealth and treasures the Heavenly Son needs, I can all offer up.

In the past, once there was a wheel-turning sage king who wanted to test the chief minister of the treasury. He immediately ordered a jeweled ship to sail on the water, and summoned the chief minister of the treasury, saying to him:
You should now provide me with wealth and treasures as needed.
At that time, the chief minister of the treasury addressed the wheel-turning sage king, saying:
Your Majesty, go to the shore, and I shall offer up what Your Majesty needs.
If we do not go ashore, it will be difficult to accomplish our mission.
Then the king should turn the jeweled ship and moor it beside the shore.
The chief minister of treasures, holding in his two hands a supreme jeweled vase made of four kinds of gold, filled with various treasures, will present it to the king, and say to the sage king:
Accept the supreme jeweled treasures I offer.
And he will speak a verse, saying:
The fine rain from the heavens descends with clear shadows, bowing near the hot heavens in the height of summer,
Holding the various treasures to offer to the wheel-turning king, and giving to the other poor and destitute ones,
They, having received it, are all happy, and the beggars all give rise to joyful minds.
Because of this, the karmic retribution is vast and endless, and one obtains the most supreme great wealth,
Having great spiritual powers and possessing the heavenly eye, one will become the honored one, the wheel-turning sage king.
He also asked:
What is the cause for the chief minister treasure obtaining great wealth, a vast treasury, and increasing enjoyment?
Answer:

The chief minister treasure in the past cultivated causes extensively, namely being able to give alms to all Å›ramaá¹‡as, brÄhmaá¹‡as, the poor, those coming and going, and beggars, bestowing food, drink, clothing, flower garlands, ointments, beds, seats, houses, lamps, and other things.
For this cause, the chief minister treasure obtains great wealth, a vast treasury, and increasing enjoyment.
Again, it is asked:

What is the cause for the chief minister treasure, born of superior karmic retribution, being able to possess the heavenly eye, and being able to see all hidden treasures, whether they have an owner or not, whether they are in water or on land, whether they are near or far?
Answer:

The minister of treasures, in his past cultivation of causes, his affairs were vast, namely, he did not harm his parents, acquaintances, teachers, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as, brÄhmaá¹‡as, and so forth, and he loved those who did not harm others. Moreover, he universally acted as a light for all the darkness of the world, bestowing lamps and lamp-kindling implements, destroying all darkness and making everything bright.

For this reason, the minister of treasures, by the superior karmic retribution of his victorious actions, was able to possess the heavenly eye, and could see all the hidden treasures in the water and on land, far and near.
Next, a verse says:
Food, drink, clothing, flower garlands, and so forth, in the past you have given rise to pure thoughts,
With your own hands you have held and offered, opening the door of giving, and with lamps you have illuminated the darkness.
You have become the minister of treasures, attending on the famous wheel-turning king,
Vastly rich and prosperous, possessing great wealth, you are able to attain the heavenly eye and see hidden treasures.
He also asked:
What are the causes for a wheel-turning sage king to obtain the treasure of a general?
Answer:

A wheel-turning sage king, in his past cultivation of causes, his affairs were vast, namely, he did not give rise to harm towards his parents, acquaintances, teachers, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as, and he loved those who did not harm others. In the darkness and obscurity, he made bright light, giving lamps and making them all bright.
For these causes, a wheel-turning sage king obtains the treasure of a general.
As for the treasure of a general, he is wise, sharp, and well-judging, and fully endowed with wisdom.
When he comes before the king, he assists the king with the right Dharma and benefits in the present world, and also fully assists with the right Dharma and benefits in the next world.
In the midst of the army, he knows the king's intentions, keeping those who should be kept and dismissing those who should be dismissed.
Without the king's power, and also without the four armies exerting themselves, causing them to become tired and weary, all of them will naturally submit.
Furthermore, there is a verse:
For those in the world who are in the darkness of ignorance, universally create lamps and lights to illuminate them,
Bestow various lamps and light, all causing them to be vast and brightly illuminated.
Moreover, for one's parents, acquaintances, and other Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as,
Extensively create lamps and lights to universally illuminate them, all able to destroy the darkness and shine brightly.
Due to this wholesome karma that bestows peace and happiness, and other well-performed excellent deeds,
The wheel-turning king, by means of this superior karmic cause, obtains the great wisdom and the treasure of the commander of the armies.
He also asked:
What is the cause for the treasure of the commander of the armies to be intelligent, bright, skillful in analogies, good at discernment, and endowed with wisdom?
He replied:

As for that precious chief minister of the army, in his past lives he established causes in the past, and even in his very distant past lives before that, when he had already ended and extinguished [his past lives] and attained human form, he would go to befriend and respectfully inquire of the wise Å›ramaá¹‡as and brÄhmaá¹‡as who were intelligent and sharp-witted, who possessed wisdom, and who were good at discerning:ğŸ”½What is good?ğŸ”½What is not good?
What is sinful?
What is sinless?
What should I do to attain the supreme and be free from sinful karma?

Having heard what he did, he practiced in accordance with the Dharma, always well discerning and always well contemplating, diligently seeking and requesting for the sake of an event or cause, doing extremely difficult things, practicing causes of universal rescue, and increasing his utmost sincere resolve, pressing on and practicing.
For this reason, he became intelligent, sharp-witted, and possessed wisdom.
Furthermore, a verse says:
In the past, he befriended the wise, diligently seeking and discerning the causes of various good deeds,
Aroused the supreme beneficial mind, and were untiring in all places.
The power of the military minister treasure, now attained wisdom and possessed clear understanding,
Swiftly aroused the mind of diligence, and now became the military treasure of the wheel-turning king.
In the great treatise on the Abhidharma, the third general verse of the chapter on establishment says:
The wheel-turning sage king possesses all, the wheel treasure, elephant, horse, and pearl treasure,
The female treasure, the minister of treasures, and the minister of war, long life without illness, endowed with form and appearance,
Pleasant and self-mastery, and many sons, as extensively explained in the third aggregate.
As explained in the treatise, the wheel-turning sage king is the same as the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

Because the eightfold right path taught by the Buddha can destroy all afflictions in the world and attain unobstructedness in all dharmas.

Because the four bases of supernatural power spoken by the Buddha can destroy all afflictions in the world and attain unobstructed understanding of all dharmas.

Like the Buddha's four right efforts, one quickly attains the fruit of tranquil quiescence beyond conditioned existence.

Just as when a wheel-turning sage king possesses the female treasure, one should know that it is the same as the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One's factor of joy.

Just as a wheel-turning sage king with a long lifespan who abides in the world for a long time, one should know that he is the same as the TathÄgata, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One who abides in the world for a long time, fulfilling all the wishes and aspirations of sentient beings.
